com.jackbe.presto.connect
Interface Connection

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseConnection
public interface Connection

A Presto Connect interface to the Mashup Server. There are two implementations:

  • LocalConnection - for invoking the server when clients are co-located in the same JVM.
  • RemoteConnection - for invoking the server remotely over HTTP/REST.

Author:
JackBe Corp.

Method Detail

invoke

public JUMPResponse invoke(java.lang.String sid,
                           java.lang.String oid,
                           java.util.Map params,
                           java.util.Map headers)

Invokes a service operation on the Mashup Server for a given service and operation with optional, named parameters and headers. Use this method for operations that expose parameter names, such as services that use a REST protocol.

Parameters:
sid - Presto service ID.
oid - Presto operation ID.
params - A Map of the request parameters.
headers - A Map of the request headers.
Returns:
JUMPResponse object

invoke

public JUMPResponse invoke(java.lang.String sid,
                           java.lang.String oid,
                           java.util.List params,
                           java.util.Map headers)

Invokes a service operation on the Mashup Server for a given service and operation with optional unnamed parameters and headers. Use this method for operations that do not expose parameter names, where parameters must be passed in an expected order. For example DAO services using JDK 1.4 or earlier do not store method arguments names in class files.

Parameters:
sid - Presto service ID.
oid - Presto operation ID.
params - A List of the request parameters.
headers - A Map of the request headers.
Returns:
JUMPResponse object

invoke

public JUMPResponse invoke(JUMPRequest request)

Invokes the Mashup Server with a preformatted JUMP request. The JUMPRequest can include JUMP headers. See ServiceRequestObject.

Parameters:
request - A JUMPRequest object with the request parameters and headers, plus optional JUMP headers.
Returns:
JUMPResponse object

setServerAddress

public void setServerAddress(java.lang.String serverAddress)

Sets the Mashup Server address in the format http://host:port/presto/edge/api.

Note: you only need to set the server address for remote connections.

Parameters:
serverAddress - The address of the Mashup Server.

getServerAddress

public java.lang.String getServerAddress()

Returns the Mashup Server address.

Returns:

login

public java.lang.String login(java.lang.String userId,
                              java.lang.String password)

Logs a user into the Mashup Server using Presto credentials (user name and password).

Parameters:
userId - The user name.
password - The password.
Returns:
Returns an authentication token string.
